io.deepstream

Interface RecordHasCallback


  • public interface RecordHasCallback
    Callback for checking if a record exists locally or remotely, used by RecordHandler.has(String, RecordHasCallback)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onRecordFound(java.lang.String recordName)
      Called if the record exists either locally ( in which case sync ) or remotely ( async )
      void onRecordHasError(java.lang.String recordName, DeepstreamException deepstreamException)
      Called if an error occured while checking for the record remotely.
      void onRecordNotFound(java.lang.String recordName)
      Called if the record doesn't exist locally and remotely ( always async )

    • Method Detail

      • onRecordFound

        void onRecordFound(java.lang.String recordName)
        Called if the record exists either locally ( in which case sync ) or remotely ( async )
        Parameters:
        recordName - The name of the record that has been found

      • onRecordNotFound

        void onRecordNotFound(java.lang.String recordName)
        Called if the record doesn't exist locally and remotely ( always async )
        Parameters:
        recordName - The name of the record that has been found

      • onRecordHasError

        void onRecordHasError(java.lang.String recordName,
                    DeepstreamException deepstreamException)
        Called if an error occured while checking for the record remotely. This isn't likely to happen, and if it does will most likely be a Event.MESSAGE_DENIED, although it could also be a storage failure such as Event.STORAGE_RETRIEVAL_TIMEOUT or Event.CACHE_RETRIEVAL_TIMEOUT
        Parameters:
        recordName - The name of the record that has been found
        deepstreamException - The DeepstreamException thrown
